title: Coolant Pressure Cap Test

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.

Do not remove the coolant pressure cap when the engine is hot. When the engine is hot, the coolant inside the radiator is hot and also under pressure. Contact with hot coolant will cause scalds and skin damage.
It is recommended to carry out coolant pressure cap and cooling system pressure tests consecutively.

Allow the engine temperature to cool for at least 30 minutes.
Check the condition of the upper and lower seals of the coolant pressure cap.

body.name: Coolant Pressure Cap Testing ccer  D Series

body.body: If there is any sign of damage or deterioration replace the cap.
Select the correct test adapter and securely fasten to the pressure cap.
Carefully connect the hand pump to the adapter ensuring an air tight seal is maintained.

body.name: Coolant Pressure Cap Test D Series cgwq_5

body.body: Pressure test the cap to it’s 1.1 bar blow off pressure. If the coolant cap opens at a lower pressure, fails to open at the correct pressure or the seal leaks, replace the cap.
